The bad news is that that's not true. The good news is that the truth is out there, buried in the middle of a dense paragraph of WI 18.29:

❝Inform also needs to determine scope at other times, too: for instance, when deciding whether a rule conditional on being "in the presence of" something is valid.❞

What `in the presence of` really means is that the described object is in scope.

Ok, now to backfill explanations of what those #Inform7 action pattern clauses are:

`in the presence of <description of objects>` is described by WI 7.12

❝this applies when the action takes place in the same location as the person named: and of course that person can also be described more vaguely ("… in the presence of a woman", say), and can just as easily be an inanimate thing ("… in the presence of the radio set").❞

title: GitHub - dokato/todor: TODOr - RStudio add-in for finding TODO, FIXME, CHANGED etc. comments in your code.

last_post.content:
TODOr is a sweet #RStats package that’s really handy for package developers.

If you write comments such as TODO, FIXME, IDEA etc as you’re working in an RStudio project, a call to `todor()` lists in a ‘Markers’ pane all the places they occur, and any further comment alongside them.

This makes it really easy to see what needs doing/fixing etc and to go back to those places.

The package also provides an RStudio Addin.

https://github.com/dokato/todor

The Almond Pirates by @annaleen (published in Anthropocene Magazine) deserves awards.

On top of Newitz' always-excellent prose, it's a deeply human story about community and the distribution of resources.

Most of all, it's the best SFF about restorative and reparative justice you'll read.

If we (as progressive SFF fans) truly believe in dealing with systemic inequity in policing and justice, we need to be imagining this kind of system and depicting it with integrity.

https://www.anthropocenemagazine.org/2022/09/the-almond-pirates

Lots of people are using bird.makeup to follow people that are already on the fediverse and it's something I want to fix.

I'm prototyping using #wikidata to discover fediverse accounts of Twitter users, see my query: https://w.wiki/6anz

This could be a way to add links to their other profile, in a way that scale and is moderated by reusing the work of the #wikipedia community. Downside would be that it will only be for VIP users.

Thoughts?

title: Two algorithms for randomly generating aperiodic tilings

last_post.content: #monotile Reading this https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/quasiblog/aperiodic-tilings/ on plotting monotiles, it talks about substitution rules making smaller and smaller tiles, but it seemed to me there should be a recurrence relation for plotting larger and larger monotiled patches from the H7/H8 rule. And there is, here's my code https://gist.github.com/bazzargh/961b6765042b17c0c25eadcc98b080e6 this also explains why H7/H8 tiles have 7/8 tiles at the base layer (one flipped) and 6/7 in later layers-the flipped tile is a hole!

#monotile Reading this https://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/quasiblog/aperiodic-tilings/ on plotting monotiles, it talks about substitution rules making smaller and smaller tiles, but it seemed to me there should be a recurrence relation for plotting larger and larger monotiled patches from the H7/H8 rule. And there is, here's my code https://gist.github.com/bazzargh/961b6765042b17c0c25eadcc98b080e6 this also explains why H7/H8 tiles have 7/8 tiles at the base layer (one flipped) and 6/7 in later layers-the flipped tile is a hole!

(i'm so sorry about the repost, i don't understand how the original announcement got deleted. I'd really appreciate if you could boost this again 🙏​)

Hi! I made a new game!

This is called Souvenirs, it's a paper role-playing game for one player, about going on a week-long vacation and writing a journal of the places you visit, and most importantly the items you get as souvenirs during your trips.

https://remi-tootata.itch.io/souvenirs

It was made during the #TinyKeepsakeJam on itch.io and it's kind of a big deal for me, as it is both my first journaling game and a first experimentation for a big project that i've been dreaming about for a few years. This is definitely a complete experience, but i've also used it to test the waters and i have lots of new ideas for that bigger project, i hope i can bring it to life someday!

I truly hope you have a nice time with it 💕

#NewGame #GameDev #TabletopGames #TTRPG #SoloRPG #GameJam #JournalingRPG #JournalingGame #CozyArt #ColorfulArt

The citizens of #SanFrancisco are certainly sophisticated and grounded enough to know the difference between property crimes and violent crimes. The key is not to weaponize everything for one's faction. Perhaps this is a good start.

title: The platforms lining up to replace Twitter – and what they offer publishers

last_post.content:
Yet more Press that gets Mastodon wrong!

Mastodon’s growth has not slowed down. We just added 1 million users in less than a month—for a total of 11 million!

There was a momentary spike in November that resulted in Mastodon hitting 2.5 million MAUs, most generated from sign-ups.

But since then, the rate of growth has been consistent. In fact, compared year-over-year, sign-ups have more than tripled.

And that’s just looking at sign-ups!

https://pressgazette.co.uk/platforms/twitter-alternatives-journalists/

ESA's NNO-1 ground station with the 35m antenna in New Norcia, Australia is currently communicating with JUICE and receiving telemetry such as temperatures, voltages, configuration information, etc.

Unlike https://eyes.nasa.gov/dsn/dsn.html, this site does not show the tx/rx frequency bands or bit rates.

Fareed Zakaria: TikTok is dangerously addictive. We should regulate it now. https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2023/04/14/tiktok-teens-mental-health-regulation/

Just wanted to share that I've been using https://elk.zone ( from @elk ) as a Mastodon web interface for a while now and I'm really happy with it.

So many things about it are better than the default #mastodon UI. Reading threads is notably nicer, and it supports multiple accounts, and it seems to get updates about notifications way sooner than the built-in UI ?!?!

Anyway. It's worth checking out.

I can't stop thinking about giant waves today.

This video blew my mind and if you're at all fascinated by the ocean, mysterious dangers within it, and GIGANTIC 80 FT + WAVES check it out:

https://youtu.be/tktJss1x0eA

There are planets with clouds made of vaporized rocks. Others may have iron rain or winds blowing with the ingredients for jewels. It's a big universe. @NASAWebb allows us to peer into exoplanet atmospheres to better understand all the worlds out there.

title: Scholastic, and a Faustian Bargain — Pretty Ok Maggie

last_post.content:
Here is a must-read post from children's author Maggie Tokuda-Hall on how Scholastic offered to distribute her book — all she had to do was remove all mention of racism.

Sure, they're banning books in Tennessee and Texas. But it's not just the books that get published and then banned from the library. It's all the books that don't get published in the first place.

Those banning books know publishers like Scholastic pull this cowardly bullshit. It's their game plan.

https://www.prettyokmaggie.com/blog/2023/4/11/scholastic-and-a-faustian-bargain

title: Indigenous Legal History – Vision Maker Media

last_post.content:
Call for Proposals: Faculty in History and College of Law at UNL are leading the Law and Race Initiative funded by the Mellon Foundation with Vision Maker Media. We are seeking producers interested in making a short documentary that fits within Indigenous legal history.

We will select the production of 2 documentaries of up to 40 minutes. Funds (up to $25,000) will support the production of a film produced by a Native filmmaker

Proposals due June 30, Please share!

https://visionmakermedia.org/indigenous-legal-history

#documentary #grant #law #history #film #DH

This well-written Open Access article by Shannon McGregor and @kreissdaniel critiques political polarization scholarship for overlooking the tension between progress toward social justice and social cohesion. With an important point that platforms cannot solve the underlying injustices that drive polarization. Platform's tech-solutionism for social cohesion thus ignores (and may risk undermining) struggles for progress. https://doi.org/10.1177/14614448231161880

The 20-year-old YouTuber whose Discord server unexpectedly became a national security threat encouraged people to subscribe to his patreon and said "the CIA may have put me on their watchlist.. but I should be on YOURS too!” https://www.nytimes.com/2023/04/11/business/discord-leaked-military-documents.html
